thread.title_full: Midwest Network and Cloud Hosting Provider Enhances Managed Services Offering

author: Kim Bode
title: Midwest Network and Cloud Hosting Provider Enhances Managed Services Offering
text:
US Signal, an industry-leading network and cloud-hosting provider, has announced the addition of Remote Monitoring and Management (RMM) to its managed services portfolio. RMM takes over the management and monitoring of servers and endpoints up to the operating system (OS) level and can prevent many infrastructure failures from happening. By combining real-time monitoring of critical servers and endpoints with patch management and optimal managed anti-virus and remediation, RMM ensures the reliability and stability of the customer’s IT assets. “We have seen more and more companies that don’t have the time to focus on these services in-house,” said Derrin Rummelt, Product Development Manager at US Signal. “Many companies risk compliance issues if their servers and security endpoints are not consistently updated, supported or maintained according to the requirements set in place. Without managed services, organizations run the risk of increased security vulnerability, downtime by not keeping up on patching, and other critical situations.”
A regularly maintained infrastructure exposes the customer to fewer failures, yielding higher productivity and savings on support costs. Exposure to security risk is dramatically lessened and allows the customer to focus on core business functions.
With eight physical data centers and over 14,000-miles of fiber, US Signal’s fully deployed network is guaranteed to deliver resiliency, flexibility and scalability. US Signal is the most robust cloud provider in the Midwest and includes both HIPAA and PCI Compliant Cloud and Network-based solutions. New and existing customers rely on US Signal for data backup, disaster recovery, management, professional services and managed services.
For more information about US Signal, please visit: https://ussignal.com .
About US Signal:
With over 14,000 miles of lit fiber and metro rings in 23 strategic tier-one, tier-two and tier-three markets, US Signal’s infrastructure is one of the largest fully deployed networks in the Midwest. The network’s optical backbone features Cisco Systems’ latest carrier class architecture and supports all of US Signal’s products. US Signal’s product portfolio includes a full suite of colocation, disaster recovery, security and cloud hosting services to complement its network offerings. Delivery of these services over their protected network ensures US Signal customers unparalleled flexibility, resiliency and scalability to meet their business needs.
